newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Senior Chinese economic officials arrive in Taiwan.
newsitem.headline: Senior Chinese economic officials arrive in Taiwan.

text.p: Chinese economic officials arrived in Taiwan on Wednesday, the second senior mainland delegation to visit Taiwan since the death of Chinese patriarch Deng Xiaoping.

The 15-member delegation, led by Liu Zhentao, economic bureau director of China's cabinet-level Taiwan Affairs Office, had been invited by Taipei's private Chinese National Federation of Industries for a 12-day visit, a federation spokeswoman said.
Liu said on Taiwan's state television he hoped the visit could further improve economic relations between the rival sides of the Taiwan Strait.
"We hope to hold seminars with Taiwan business and academic sectors in order to further improve our communication, which can help promote economic relations between the sides," Liu said.
He said businessmen from China and Taiwan had established good relations in the past several years.
He dismissed reports that China wanted to use Taiwan businessmen to force Taipei to have direct commercial and other links with Beijing.
Taiwan's Nationalist government has banned direct contact with China since losing their civil war to the Chinese communists in 1949.
Liu and his party were the second group of senior Chinese officials to visit Taiwan since Deng died on February 19.

A 30-member group led by Wang Xiaomin, deputy director of the exchange bureau of the Taiwan Affairs Office and also a daughter of China's retired parliament chief, Wan Li, arrived in Taiwan on the day of Deng's death.
